fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page in a space which contains some content
# Add a Page Tree macro to it (no parameters required)
# Export to PDF
#- Observe that the Page Tree is not rendered in the PDF.

This markup wont be rendered if you export to pdf:

{pagetree:root=@home|excerpt=true|expandCollapseAll=true|startDepth=3}

Attached are:
* How it looks in Confluence
* Exported pdf file

When fixed need to be checked with page layouts as well.

fields.description:
Under a search of "ancestorIds:425988 AND test", the did you mean code will always say "Did you mean: *ancestoring*:425988 AND [Search Term]", which makes things more confusing since the user did not even add the ancestorIds bit to the search. It shouldn't change ancestorIds to ancestoring.

Workaround as suggested [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Pagetree+Macro?focusedCommentId=179438520#comment-179438520]:
# Create an empty page with the page title _ancestorIds_
# Goto your _Confluence Administration_
# Goto _Administration_ -> _Content Indexing_
# Rebuild the _"Did You Mean Index"_
fields.summary: ancestorIds:pageid changes to "Did you mean ancestoring:pageid"

fields.description:

fields.description:

The criticality of this bug is that there is no easy way to delete a inconsistent space from the database.

If the import fails, Confluence should be able to rollback what was imported before the crash.
fields.summary: Import failure leaves the database inconsistent

fields.description:
Reading through [the Web Resource Transformer Module docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Web+Resource+Transformer+Module], I'm still pretty unclear how to use this plugin module type. It describes the {{atlassian-plugins.xml}} syntax but says almost nothing about the implementing class, including what interface it needs to implement.

The docs for the {{class}} attribute should at least name the interface or superclass with a link to the JavaDocs. More comprehensive documentation of how to write an implementation would be even more helpful. So would a link to source code for the {{com.atlassian.labs.template.TemplateTransformer}} class used in the example.
fields.summary: Web Resource Transformer Module documentation is incomplete

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21175].
  {panel}

I am preparing a migration from 2.10.3 to 3.4.1

I have noticed that this 2.10.3 folder confluence-home\framework-bundles
is fully replaced by confluence-home\plugins-osgi-cache\framework-bundles in 3.4.1

However the upgrade - even if successful - does not get rid of the old folder.

On a successful upgrade to 3.X, please get rid of confluence-home\framework-bundles.
Extra files or folders are just a source of confusion.
fields.summary: delete the folder framework-bundles in the confluencehome folder after a successful upgrade from 2.X to 3.X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21174].
{panel}
The folder confluence-home\plugins-temp seems to be used by at least the non bundled plugins to extract some libraries they depend on and which are packaged in the corresponding jar in META-INF/lib.
I have compared the content of this folder for a couple of plugins available from the plugin manager search menu or directly from the authors (calendar, cache, linking, multi-excerpt).
My understanding is that this is the standard way to add dependent jars to a confluence plugin, the plugin framework taking care of extracting them to confluence-home\plugins-temp when required.

The issue if that EACH time the server/confluence starts (or the plugin reinstalled I guess), it does it.
As an example on a DEV server I have <<616>> files in this folder corresponding in fact to the same 8 jars, 77 versions of each of them!!!
This server is not restarted everyday and this is a good thing or we would have 10, 20 or 30 times more files.

You need to do something.
This folder can be part of a backup and this is no good to waste disk space for nothing.

I simply suggest when confluence starts to clear the content of the folder.

 

*Note*: There is also a related bug for this situation that's been logged at CONFSERVER-52749
fields.summary: When confluence starts, empty the content of the plugins-temp folder

fields.description: We have now documented how to create your own keyboard shortcuts in Confluence using the Keyboard Shortcut plugin module type. This means a user could create a plugin that overrides an existing shortcut. When this happens the keyboard shortcut help dialog will display both shortcuts, even though only one of the shortcuts will actually work. We should fix this so that only the shortcut that will actually work (that is the shortcut with the lowest order attribute) will be displayed.
fields.summary: The keyboard shortcut help dialog should only show the shortcut with the lowest order when there are two shortcuts that use the same key

fields.description:
It would be great if user macros could be defined to target specific spaces, instead of being accessible across an entire Confluence instance. A couple of advantages of this improvement are:
- Reduces clutter in the macro browser
- Prevents space-specific macros from needing to have names like [SpaceName][MacroName]
- Allows macros with similar, although slightly different, functionality to share the same name

This improvement request is somewhat similar to [CONF-7826|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-7826], but does not focus on *who* can create space-specific macros.
fields.summary: Allow user macros to target specific spaces

fields.description:
Hello

After upgrading from Confluence 3.1 to 3.4 we can no longer navigate the 2 tabs on the dashboard containing a users Favourite spaces vs. all spaces.
Whenever either is clicked (if e.g. Global is active and a user click Favorites) it's target seems to be dashboard.action# having no effect.

The old confluence would use "dashboard.action?spacesSelectedTab=my/all".
We had a "custom" dashboard layout, yet it is still broken after reverting that to the default.

Edit: Forgot to mention, we didn't upgrade in the "usual" manner, since we moved to another server, we had a clean installation of Confluence 3.4 which we then imported the latest backup to.

{panel:title=Resolution|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
This was caused by an [incompatibility|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Titles+in+recently-updated-dashboard+Macro+are+Missing+after+Upgrading+from+3.3.x+to+3.4] between Confluence 3.3.x or 3.4.x and the SubSpace Plugin (1.5 or earlier). 

Updating this plugin should fix the problem, if not try disabling/removing it. If you're still having problems, please create a support request at [support.atlassian.com|http://support.atlassian.com].
{panel}
fields.summary: Can't navigate between Favorite/Global tab on dashboard.

* conf-webapp/src/main/webapp/decorators/panels/alert.vmd
* conf-webapp/src/main/webapp/decorators/panels/confirm.vmd
* conf-webapp/src/main/webapp/decorators/panels/info.vmd

Usages look like this:

fields.description:
Changes which are made in the Rich Text Editor Full-screen mode are lost unless you Exit full screen mode to save.

How to reproduce:

1. Edit a page in the rich text editor
2. Make some changes Before going to full-screen mode
3. Enter full screen mode and make some more changes
4. Save the page using the Shortcut  (Control-S or Cmd-S) Without leaving full screen mode

Note that the changes from Step 2 will be applied,  but NOT the changes from Step 3.
fields.summary: RTE changes are lost when using the Save shortcut (Control-S) in Full Screen mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21127].
  {panel}

This is an improvement request to allow specifying which user to be used in trusted connection with JIRA.

Proposed example next to the documented examples in [Jira Issues Macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro]
bq. *Anonymous=false*: EITHER use the user credentials defined by the
Administrator OR if they're not present then use the user's credentials

In short allow Confluence to use a specific username to communicate with JIRA regardless of the credentials of the user viewing the page.
fields.summary: Allow to specify which user to be used in trusted connection with JIRA

fields.description:
This is sort-of related to the already fixed [CONF-14090].

The scenario is as follows:
* Watcher has their email settings set up so that they get emails from people in their network.
* Watcher is following Editor but not following Mover.
* Editor is the last editor of Page.
* Mover moves Page to a new parent.

Watcher *should not get an email* about Page because they aren't watching it, or its space, or the person who moved it.  *But they do.*

It *looks* to me based on com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.listeners.AbstractNotificationsListener#getUserWhoTriggeredEvent that the only change required to fix this is to make PageMoveEvent implement UserDriven.
fields.summary: Network notifications for move page use the last editor, not the mover

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21119].
  {panel}

On the _Confluence Admin > Logging and Profiling_ page you can choose the type of Log4j logging to use: either Production or Diagnostic.  However, there's no way to know which type is currently in use.  If you have previously chosen the Diagnostic mode, which our docs warn can degrade performance, you have no way to know whether this mode is currently being used.

*Steps to Repro:*
# On a fresh instance, where you have yet to edit logging settings, go to _Confluence Admin > Logging and Profiling_.
# Since this is the first time you've seen this page you can assume that the default logging option, Production, is being used. Click the Diagnostic button.
# The page will reload. Look at the Log4j logging options.

*Expected:*
The Diagnostic button will be disabled, since it is in use and therefore clicking it is fruitless, or some other intuitive UX technique will be used to show that a binary flip is set in some way.

*Actual:*
Both buttons are enabled and clickable and nothing shows which option is currently in use.
fields.summary: display current logging level

2010/10/28 The problem finally disappeared. The plugin manager works now OK.

We have our own repositories. I have added yours to the list (upper) but with no change.
It fails with all of them like below. 

Downloading: http://asbscr.ic.gc.ca/maven-proxy/repository/all-released/org/twdata/pkgscanner/package-scanner/0.9.4/package-scanner-0.9.4.pom
[INFO] Unable to find resource 'org.twdata.pkgscanner:package-scanner:pom:0.9.4' in repository asb-repository (http://asbscr.ic.gc.ca/maven-proxy/repository/all-released)
Downloading: https://maven.atlassian.com/repository/public/org/twdata/pkgscanner/package-scanner/0.9.4/package-scanner-0.9.4.pom
[WARNING] Unable to get resource 'org.twdata.pkgscanner:package-scanner:pom:0.9.4' from repository atlassian-repository (https://maven.atlassian.com/repository/public): Error transferring file: Remote
 host closed connection during handshake

I am not sure if this is what you mean, talking about missing plug-ins to notify you about on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Atlassian+Maven+Repositories
Nevertheless, the files are on your site and I can see them with my browser and I will download them manually and install them.
We are not yet on the automated build server for the change to 3.4...

Thanks


2010/11/02 update
I learned today that our local maven administrators maintained a white list related to Atlassian due to previously failing dependencies.
The above dependencies were not part of it and as a consequence could not be loaded.
Thanks to close this ticket.
fields.summary: cannot get some dependencies from the atlassian repository for Confluence 3.4
Add section 508 compatible captcha to Confluence
REST API for searching pages by labels does not return any results

fields.description: Please add an additional check box for Minor Change near the top Save button. When on a low resolution screen, it takes extra effort to scroll down to check off Minor Change. And people new to Confluence generally don't notice it, no matter how often you ask them to use it, when they can't see it.
fields.summary: Additional Minor Change check-off

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Confluence \{attachments} macro.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these: 
* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/HgdrDQ
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in Attachments macro

fields.description: The TestNG reports generated by surefire are quite hard to read by comparison to JUnit reports (or even the txt logs) for the same test set. We should improve the readability of these reports, so that it's easier to diagnose TestNG test failures, and there are fewer reasons not to run the parallel build on each developer's desktop.
fields.summary: Make the TestNG report format more readable
Body of the 'Expand' user macro is not included in a PDF export

Steps to replicate:
# Change the language to French
# Edit a page either with the Rich Text editor or Wiki Markup
# Open the 'Insert Image' option
# The text "Drop here" isn't translated (see attachment)
fields.summary: Add Image in WYSIWYG isn't completely translated to French

fields.description:
Current confluence hard codes the version of package scanner to 0.7.7 in the top level pom.xml.

The version tested and built with for the plugin framework is currently 0.9.4. The build should be updated (if possible) just to use the version required by the plugin framework rather than overriding it at the top level.

Note that upgrading to the newer version of this package will likely increase the number of INFO / WARN log messages coming from this library (due to some packages being exported from more than one jar). We may need to either reduce the default logging, or fix the underlying export issues.
fields.summary: Confluence is including an old version of package-scanner, rather than the version required/built/tested with the plugin framework.

fields.description:
*Steps to repro:*
# Go to _Confluence Admin > General Configuration_
# Click on the Plugin Administration Page link under Feature Settings

*Expected:*
User is taken to the UPM (_\[Confluence Address\]/plugins/servlet/upm_)

*Actual:*
User is taken to the legacy Plugin Manager (_\[Confluence Address\]/admin/plugins.action_)
fields.summary: Plugin Administration Page link should point to UPM rather than legacy plugin manager

fields.description:
I attempted to integrate Confluence 3.4 and Crucible 2.3.6 in a manner that would allow Crucible widgets to be placed on a Confluence page.  I basically followed the instructions here, but replaced JIRA with Confluence:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Gadgets+in+Crucible

After following the steps for setting up OAuth (as the document suggests), I wasn't able to view data.  In the Confluence logs the following error would appear:

{noformat}
2010-10-19 03:55:11,324 WARN [http-8080-5] [shindig.gadgets.oauth.OAuthResponseParams] logDetailedWarning OAuth fetch fatal error
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest | userName: dhansen | referer: http://confluence:8080/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=32212516864&country=GB&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22false%22%7D&st=atlassian%3A82Pv4Sf6klrwo%2Btupa5wh7GGNdb1hbdJMxmBd4Yo3dBYwWSv3eAXhxciSgzCb9DQ1jQqWlNWPxjStVyESovbNlRVwxuX1PEuAu8B5a%2FtZmpNHHitiqWBi9uYiQRgYI3bVLsESX1ajAxZihXpg56X6H3M7NqE9WHAGu%2FSnjZlpdwOxQBva2fJoRuuNw6kC9BHLutpH6oedGsUIxChwi0y5cehL%2BLRIwOl4me2uIzn9Lev1onJrcZf2cdJdIQ4JiIYZ5pS3xCRmAkUSC59AxGRv2BUL03IpQV1vGod3rs0HmSX2sG0LZg54EXUjV9xdaQevPBBWg%3D%3D&url=http%3A%2F%2Fdevtools%3A8060%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.fecru.fecru-gadgets-plugin%3AoverdueReviews%2Fgadgets%2Ftodo.xml&libs=auth-refresh
{noformat}

However, once I configured the Trusted Applications link between the two applications, the widgets were viewed properly.  It's important to note that with JIRA, I didn't have to do this.  

It appears that there may be an issue with OAuth alone and we require Trusted Apps to make this work.  If that's the case, we should update the necessary documentation.  If it's not, we should probably fix this so the integration works with OAuth alone.
fields.summary: Crucible Widgets in Confluence Require Trusted Apps, Not Just OAuth

fields.description:
Can there be a way to permission comments? 

We use Confluence for user documentation, and would like the ability to have certain users' comments to be hidden from end users. For example, if an internal employee makes a comment on a documentation page, we would like for it to be visible only to other employees, not end users. Alternatively, a comment review option (i.e., comments do not appear unless marked visible by a moderator) might work as well.

We are still evaluating Confluence, but this would be a great feature for when we move to production. Thanks!
fields.summary: Create permissions for comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21072].
  {panel}

h5. Why rearrange?
\\
Based on the following documentation, the order of the column in indexing is important:

- [Database Column order|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Index_(database)#Column_order]

The upgrade task should also rearrange database indexes which is important to improve the performance of database, please have a look at the following screenshots.

*Upgraded instance*

!conf_3.3.3_upgrade.png!

*Fresh install*

!conf_3.3.3_fresh.png!

h5. Why remove?
{quote}
Another disadvantage is using too many indexes can actually slow your database down
{quote}

Also, quoted above from the following link:

- [Introduction to Database Indexes|http://www.interspire.com/content/2006/02/15/introduction-to-database-indexes/]

Upgrade task also should remove indexes that is not required anymore.

Currently an upgraded Confluence instance, still retains the orders of indexes and also some indexes that are not in use anymore. For example, when we upgrade Confluence 2.8.3 to Confluence 3.3.3, the index {{cl_spacekey_idx}} is still remain in the upgraded instance, but not in fresh install.

Regards,
HengHwa
fields.summary: Upgrade task should rearrange database indexes and remove indexes that is not in use anymore

fields.description:
Confluence comments are all displayed with an indication of how old they are.  Sometimes it's "10 minutes ago", sometimes it's "Jan 22, 2009", and sometimes it's "Aug 09".
When you list them like that it's clear what they all mean.  But when you just see "Aug 09" it's very easy to assume it means "August 2009".

*A date format of just "MMM DD" is inherently ambiguous for an increasing number of dates.*

My suggested fix would be to always include the year.  Also "Month Day, Year" is a stupid format since the smallest increment is in the middle, not at either end.  I'd vote for "Day Month Year" but "Year Month Day" also makes sense.
fields.summary: Date format in comments is misleading

fields.description:
From CONF-17292:

One cause of this problem is using the wrong suffix for Office 2007-style spreadsheets, which are normally saved with a .xlsx suffix. If the file was uploaded using a .xls suffix, Confluence will give it the old Excel spreadsheet MIME type application/vnd.ms-excel.

You can see that this has happened if you use the {viewxls} parameters to limit the number of rows and columns displayed. Since it bypasses the code that incorrectly interprets arbitrary XML text as row and column counts, it will not cause Confluence to crash, but you will see that all of the cells are filled with XML and Javascript-like code instead of the expected values.

To correctly interpret these files, the file must have the proper MIME-type, which is application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet.

Because of the numerous occasions on which these files can be misnamed, and the possibility of crashing an entire wiki, I'd say this is a major problem. At a minimum, making the attachment upload process more persnickety would help a lot.
fields.summary: Excel file with incorrect suffix can cause OutOfMemory errors
